channel.title: BBC News
channel.description: Feed from BBC News - with images and summaries

item.title: Armed man killed after entering secure perimeter of Trump's residence, Secret Service says
item.description:
Armed man killed after entering secure perimeter of Trump's residence, Secret Service says 2 hours ago Share Save George Wright Share Save Getty Images An armed man has been shot dead after entering the secure perimeter of US President Donald Trump's Mar-a-Lago residence in Florida, the Secret Service has said. The man was carrying a shotgun and fuel can when he was stopped and shot by Secret Service agents and a Sheriff's deputy, authorities said. The incident happened around...

item.title: Mexico's most wanted drug lord 'El Mencho' killed in military operation
item.description:

item.title: Trump curious why Iran has not 'capitulated', US envoy Witkoff says
item.description:
Trump curious why Iran has not 'capitulated', US envoy Witkoff says 3 hours ago Share Save Jaroslav Lukiv and Ghoncheh Habibiazad , BBC Persian Share Save Reuters The US has been building up its military presence near Iran in recent weeks US President Donald Trump is questioning why Iran has not yet "capitulated" in the face of Washington's military build-up in the Middle East, the US president's special envoy Steve Witkoff has said. Witkoff told Fox News on Saturday that...

item.title: Former PM Gordon Brown urges police probe into whether Andrew used RAF bases to meet Epstein
item.description:
Brown urges police probe into whether Andrew used RAF bases to meet Epstein 6 hours ago Share Save Ed Campbell BBC News Investigations Share Save Getty Images Gordon Brown has demanded a police investigation into whether Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor used taxpayer-funded jets and RAF bases to meet the paedophile Jeffrey Epstein, according to reports. The former prime minister wrote letters to six police forces suggesting that civil servants be questioned about Andrew's time as UK trade envoy,....

item.title: Greenland says 'no thanks' to Trump US hospital boat
item.description:
Greenland says 'no thanks' to Trump US hospital boat 4 hours ago Share Save Rachel Muller-Heyndyk Share Save Getty Images The US operates two dedicated hospital boats, including the USNS Mercy Greenland's prime minister has asked US President Donald Trump to talk to him instead of making "random outbursts on social media", after Trump said he was sending a US hospital boat to "take care" of people on the island. Trump wrote on Truth Social that he was going to send a boat filled.....

item.title: Explosions kill police officer and injure 25 in western Ukraine
item.description:
Explosions kill police officer and injure 25 in western Ukraine 6 hours ago Share Save Maia Davies Share Save Anadolu via Getty Images Explosive devices were planted in waste bins, according to police A 23-year-old female police officer has been killed and 25 people injured in what Ukrainian officials have called a terror attack in the western city of Lviv. Two homemade explosive devices detonated after police crews responded to a reported break-in shortly after midnight on Sunday, the National....

item.title: 'Effective' SEND support won't be taken away, minister says
item.description:
'Effective' SEND support won't be taken away, minister says 8 hours ago Share Save Joshua Nevett Political reporter Share Save Education Secretary Bridget Phillipson: "We are not going to be taking away effective support for children" The government will not be withdrawing "effective support" from children with special educational needs and disabilities (SEND) under its planned school reforms for England, the education secretary has said. Bridget Phillipson told the BBC the...

item.title: Met officers working for Andrew told to guard Epstein's home, emails show
item.description:
Met officers working for Andrew told to guard Epstein's home, emails show 8 hours ago Share Save Olivia Davies , Chi Chi Izundu and Helena Wilkinson , BBC News Investigations Share Save PA Media Metropolitan Police officers were instructed to provide security for a dinner party at Jeffrey Epstein's New York home attended by Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor, according to emails released by the US Department of Justice. The Met says it has not identified any wrongdoing by its protection...

item.title: William in tribute to TikTok medic found dead at barracks
item.description:
William in tribute to medic found dead at barracks 5 hours ago Share Save Matty Edwards and Maisie Lillywhite , West of England Share Save Welsh Guards Prince William met Corporal Lucy Wilde in March 2024, when she was serving with the Welsh Guards The Prince of Wales has spoken of his "immense sadness" over the death of a young Army medic who had become a TikTok star. Corporal Lucy Wilde, who shared videos documenting her daily life, was found dead in her barracks in Warminster, Wiltshire, on.....

item.title: Wolves' Arokodare third player racially abused this weekend
item.description:
Image source, Getty Images Image caption, Tolu Arokodare joined Wolves from Genk for Ã‚Â£24m in September Published 51 minutes ago Wolves say they are "disgusted" after striker Tolu Arokodare was sent racist abuse on social media by "multiple perpetrators" following his side's 1-0 loss at Crystal Palace. The Nigeria international and Wolves have shared a number of screenshots of private messages he received after Sunday's Premier League game in which he had a first-half penalty saved....
